title: A Judge Speaks Out About a Leader
summary: A judge named Mark Wolf, who was chosen by President Reagan, is leaving his job after 40 years. He is worried about a leader named Donald Trump, who he says is very dangerous. In an essay, Judge Wolf wrote that the White House is attacking the rule of law, which means the rules that keep our country fair and safe. He feels he must speak up because staying quiet is not okay. He talked more about his worries in an interview. This story shows how important it is for people to stand up for what is right, even if it is hard.

background_read: Mark Wolf is a federal judge who was appointed by President Reagan. He has served for 40 years, making important decisions in court. Recently, he decided to resign because he is very concerned about Donald Trump, a former president. Judge Wolf wrote an essay saying that Trump is uniquely dangerous and that the White House is harming the rule of law. The rule of law means that laws apply to everyone, including leaders, to ensure justice. Judge Wolf believes it is his duty to speak out against this to protect democracy. This story helps us understand why it is important for people in power to stand up for what is right.
Article_Structure: WHO: Mark Wolf, a federal judge appointed by President Reagan
WHAT: He is resigning and speaking out about Donald Trump being uniquely dangerous
WHERE: In an essay published by The Atlantic and in an interview with Amna Nawaz
WHY: Because he believes the White House's assault on the rule of law is deeply disturbing and silence is intolerable
